poem:
**The Art of Airborne Laughter**

In the departure lounge of comedy,  
Abrahams boards with ZAZ,  
engineered a flight of spoofs  
that soared above the clouds,  
delighting us with humor  
at cruising altitude.  
He banks westward now,  
leaving us in the aisle,  
still laughing at the  
unexpected turbulence  
of his wit.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jim Abrahams obituary The 1980 disaster movie spoof Airplane! was a flyaway success. Made for $3.5m, it grossed over $170m and forged a new style of film comedy. It was written and directed by the trio known as ZAZ: the brothers Jerry and David Zucker, and their childhood friend Jim Abrahams, who has died aged 80 of leukaemia. There had been movie send-ups before, notably from Mel Brooks, Woody Allen and the Monty Python team.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
